si.t: Proxima Cen c: candidate planet 2020SciA....6.7467D. Proxima Cen d: candidate planet 2022A&A...658A.115F
Barnard's Star b: planet detected by 2018Natur.563..365R but controversial based on 2021AJ....162...61L
Wolf 359 b and c: unconfirmed planets 2019arXiv190604644T
GJ 411 d candidate planet uncovered by 2022AJ....163..218H
1976A&AS...26..177B mentioned a perturbation from a 15 Mjup object unconfirmed by 2019A&A...623A..72K
tau Cet e f g h: candidate planets 2017AJ....154..135F
Could be EDR3 6439125097425887488 with sep 2.2 arcsec but doubtful G-Rp=1.3 small for a midT
Could be EDR3 3117120863519565568 but doubtful because similar magnitudes
The parallax and proper motion values accounting for orbital motion are taken from the Gaia DR3 non-single star table.
Potential binarity ruled out from spectroscopic data by arXiv:2209.05814
Possible close late T companion (2008ApJ...689L..53B and 2009ApJ...695.1517L) unresolved with HST (2014AJ....148..129A)
The high dynamical mass derived by 2021AJ....162..301B may denote the existence of an unseen companion.
Candidate pre-main-sequence star in beta Pic association

EDR3 6697578465310948992 compatible with the 4.3 arcsec separation given in WDS. However the value of BP-RP = 2.161 for the companion corresponds roughly to an M2V star for which M_G=9 would predict a parallax of 50 mas
The spectroscopic binarity classification proposed by 1999A&A...344..897D is almost certainly due to activity
GJ 581 d f g: controversial planets
Possible M dwarf. EDR3 585250248258396416 in agreement with 0.527 arcsec predicted separation by 2012AJ....143...42H. 1999A&A...344..897D mention a delta_K of 0.50 compatible with delta_G = 0.358
Possible M dwarf. G 41-14 A+C is a spectroscopic binary resolved by 2020AJ....159..139L at 0.094 arcsec
Possible M dwarf. System resolved with speckle interferometry by 2022AJ....163..178V
GJ 667 C d e f g: controversial planets 2016MNRAS.463.1592C 2013A&A...556A.126A
Possible white dwarf. Spectroscopic binary in 1997AJ....113.2246R. 1999A&A...344..897D argue that the companion mass is too large (> 0.5 Msun) to be something else than a degenerate star.
The planet Fomalhaut b is refuted
Parallax taking into account the 418d orbit from 2016AJ....152..141B probably more accurate than EDR3 value
GJ 1151b is a controversial planet: detected by 2021ApJ...919L...9M but not by 2021A&A...649L..12P

The spectroscopic binarity classification proposed by 2013A&A...549A.109B is almost certainly due to activity. Visual companion: neither 2008MNRAS.384..150L nor 2012AJ....144...64D (with NICMOS onboard Hubble) detected it. We believe that 1996AJ....112.2799H made reference to the background star 2MASS J12141817+0037297 (Gaia parallax of 1.27 mas)
Incorrect radial velocity of -414 km/s in Gaia DR3
System resolved with speckle interferometry by 2022AJ....163..178V
BD+42 2320 is not a physical companion (Gaia parallax = 1.154 mas). 1987ApJ...317..343M discard the spectroscopic binarity as claimed by 1976ApJS...30..273A
Unresolved Double white dwarf candidate in 2017A&A...602A..16T
Pre-main-sequence star that may belong to the Argus / IC 2391 association
The much wider companion separated by 9.62 arcsec measured in 2010PASP..122.1195T is the background star EDR3 3101920042255163392 (parallax = 0.437 mas)
Companion to 41 Ara B published in the Gaia DR3 nss_two_body_orbit table with a mass ranging from 0.2 to 0.7 Msol and a period of 88 days
Most probable M dwarf with a mass estimate of 0.6 Msol from spectroscopic orbit in Gaia DR3
Could be a brown dwarf from its mass estimate 2014AJ....147...26D

GJ 424 B (2006AJ....132..994D) was not confirmed with adaptive optics on CFHT (2015MNRAS.449.2618W). Long term high precision radial velocities monitoring with Keck rule out any possible viable companion (2017AJ....153..208B).
Spectrosocpic binary resolved in adaptive optics 2004A&A...425..997B
Possible M dwarf. The magnitude difference between Aab and B (0.926 mag) in EDR3 1552921055949679616 is compatible with 0.85 in Ks from 2015MNRAS.449.2618W
Listed as an unresolved companion but adaptive optic observations confirm that is it single 2017ApJS..231...15D
Its kinematics shows it is most probably a halo star. It has the largest secular acceleration value of 10.51 m/s/a
GJ 1103 is single 2019AJ....157..216W the candidate companion is a background star
Spectroscopic binary according to WDS probably wrong. WDS gives BD+02 521 as a B component but its parallax is 12.33 mas
Confirmed for now. The published radial velocity signal might be simply due to sampling
Possible M dwarf. Resolved by 2004A&A...425..997B at 0.39 arcsec delta_H=3.59
2015ApJS..216....7B detected a background visual companion at 2.6 arcsec which is probably EDR3 1349047926299471360 with a 0.003 mas parallax
Earth-mass planet in the habitable zone
Listed as a Tycho double Star (TDS 6725) with 0.6 arcsec separation however 2012ApJ...754...44J fail to reveal a companion and its parallax accuracy (0.017) raises doubt about a possible binarity
Astrometric binary identification by 2022MNRAS.513.5270P. The parallax and proper motion values accounting for orbital motion are taken from the Gaia DR3 non-single star table.
2018AJ....155..125W states it may be a brown dwarf from its mass estimate compatible with the lower mass estimate of 0.046 Msol computed from the Gaia DR3 astrometric orbit.
Could be a brown dwarf from its mass estimate 2002ApJS..141..503N
Pre-main-sequence star in beta Pic association
Pre-main-sequence star in beta Pic association. AU Mic c: candidate planet 2021A&A...649A.177M
Planet candidate from Gaia DR3 https://cosmos.esa.int/web/gaia/exoplanets. The parallax and proper motion values accounting for orbital motion are taken from the Gaia DR3 non-single star table.
Might have an astrometric companion at the brown dwarf-planet boundary as reported by 2008A&A...478..187D
Possible M dwarf. A close visual companion was wrongly attributed by 2018AJ....155..265H
Most probable M dwarf with a mass estimate of 0.3 Msol from spectroscopic orbit in Gaia DR3. Separation of 4.828 arcsec and delta_I=2.25 2017A&A...597A..47C
Brown dwarf from its dynamical mass 2017ApJS..231...15D
The parallax is only an estimate
EDR3 5690033426054600320 is consistent with 2015MNRAS.449.2618W that give delta_Ks = 0.09 with a separation of 0.52 arcsec. Note of caution: the brightest has reddest bp_rp
No evidence for binarity in 2021ApJS..253....7K who thus consider it as single
Could be EDR3 1680478217385666944 but seems too bright for a T7
